Module reading: Descriptive Statistics

topics: Modeling Uncertainty with Discrete Probability Distributions

Bayesian vs frequentist statistics

grading.policies: Late assignments are penalized 10% per day and will not be accepted after solutions are posted.

policies.attendance: Attendance is mandatory for live sessions.
policies.late_work: Late assignments are penalized 10% per day and will not be accepted after solutions are posted.
policies.academic_integrity: Collaboration is allowed on homework provided each student completes their own work. Copying will result in a 0 for the assignment.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology is dedicated to providing appropriate accommodations to students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: Students are expected to attend class sessions, participate in classroom activities, and complete weekly online quizzes, homework, and discussions.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers free and confidential services.

course_info.title: Probability and Statistics for Systems Engineering

_metadata.course_description: This course is designed for students with a background in engineering, technology, or science who have not taken a class in statistics or need a refresher class.
learning_outcomes: Understand and apply probability distributions to a variety of data sets.
Understand statistics associated with probability distributions.
